title: SukSha Shabbat
description:
Join us to welcome Shabbat with prayer, ecstatic singing, and a veggie meal.  All denominations welcome to join hands and hearts. BYO plate!

Come to our large dome as the sun sets; you welcome the sabbath while a sea of twinkling stars envelope you, our public shade structures transforming from daytime misting cloudscapes to light installations. We fire up our sound responsive LED beacon to help guide anybody who hasn’t found their way, and our singing voices set it to pulse.
After the service we guide you to our dining area and seat you at a communal bedouin-style table. We fill your cup, nourish you with a multi-course meal, and ease you into the embrace of a subtle sound environment.

Be ready to leave your bottom half at the door and focus on your upper half. It is suggested to have exposed shoulders for this workshop. This will help you see the micro movements and understand the techniques.

title: Sunset Celebration-Nightly DrumCircle Extravaganza
description:
Put the Sun to bed & howl at the moon! Bring a drum, instrument, hoop, stilt, &/or anything on fire! Celebrate the sun & welcome the night! 

Join us every evening at Red Lightning for Sunset Celebration. Be a part of the largest drum-circle on the Playa (or the planet?) as we gather drummers, musicians, hula hoopers, fire poi, acrobats, stilt-walkers and sun-gazing playa citizens to celebrate the Sun's journey across the Black Rock Desert. We'll begin one hour before sundown and bring the joyous ceremony to a close after the sun ends its day.

Come be a part of this magical new playa tradition!

title: Sweat Your Prayers w/Eugene Hedlund @RhythmWave
description: 5Rhythms is an in-bodied, out of your mind dance experience not to be missed. It is a simple yet powerful moving meditation that anyone – of any age, size, or physical ability – can practice. There are no steps to follow, no choreography to learn, no way to do it wrong. The only requirement is a body that is still breathing, a heart that is still beating, and a mind that is still curious! Come "Sweat Your Prayers" with Eugene Hedlund at RhythmWave, as we bring this gorgeous dance/meditation to BRC for our 8th consecutive year!
print_description: 5Rhythms is an in-bodied, out of your mind dance experience not to be missed. Come "Sweat Your Prayers" with Eugene Hedlund at RhythmWave!

title: Tango for the Playa
description: Tango milongas are Monday and Wednesday, Blues dances are on Tuesday and Thursday. In our classes, you’ll learn how to do these two social partner dances, how to connect with the music and your partner, how to relax, you’ll get to meet and interact with your playa brethren, and you’ll dance a bunch. During the guided practice time, you’ll have a chance to practice during the day and ask questions of the experienced dancers hanging out. At happy hour, grab a cup of tea, dance and chill and watch the dome light up. Listen to live music if we have a drop-in musician (or let us know if you you’d like to play some blues or tango music at our camp). And then in the evening, dress up, and come dance the night away. We keep the music running at all hours.

title: Tantric Awareness with Ceremonial Cacao
description: A safe container where we pay loving attention and give space to all that stirs within us, find our highest expression within, and practice conscious authentic integrated relating with other souls. Ceremonial cacao is offered to enhance these senses. Through breath, guided visualization, awareness exercises and an gently acccepting atmosphere, we leave our conditioning behind and discover the pure innocent loving expression that is within all of us. Emphasis on awareness and expression of fears and desires creates the safety that allows deep, authentic connection with no artificial limits.
print_description: A safe container for deep awareness and acceptance of ourselves, and loving authentic expression and connection, assisted by ceremonial cacao.

title: Taoist Erotic Massage for Men & their Lovers
description:
The workshop is an ultra-condensed form of a type of massage developed by the Body Electric School. It combines breathwork and a sequence of erotic massage techniques which stimulate erotic energy but don’t expend it in ejaculation. The result is often a heightened erotic state some people call a “full body orgasm."
In the Body Electric workshops, these techniques are learned over a two-day weekend workshop which explores intimacy, eroticism, and personal growth.  Here, we’ve got two hours. So, we learn a shortened version just of the massage part, and change the rules a little bit: partners just work on one another, and the massage is a bit shorter. However, as past participants can tell you (and hopefully will in the comments!), the workshops are incredibly powerful, hot (in all senses of the word…), and, for some, deeply healing and transformative. A lot of guys who have done the Burning Man workshop have gone on to do Body Electric, and integrated these new forms of eroticism into their own lives.
A few guiding principles if you’re thinking of coming to the workshop:
- This is a hands-on, clothes-off workshop.  Spectators are not allowed.  You will have an opportunity to opt-out before the massage begins.
- We will be doing one round of massage, so each person will either give or receive.  Note that giving can often be more powerful than receiving.
- Givers of massage may be of any sex and gender.  We’ll be teaching the massage techniques for male bodies (i.e. people with penises).  However, the main part of the practice is not the massage but the energy and breathwork, so female-bodied people are more than welcome to participate!
- Bring a towel and water
- Pee ahead of time
- Bring purell.  We provide massage lotion
print_description: Breathwork + erotic massage = Full body orgasm.  Hands on, clothes off, loud, ecstatic, erotic, 11th year on the playa. Come early, bring towel/water

title: TEDxBlackRockCity
description:
TEDxBlackRockCity 2014
"Smart & Simple"

With this year’s theme, we will present inspirational change agents and guarantee an afternoon of ideas worth sharing.
 
We believe that there is no more fertile venue in the world to explore Smart & Simple than Black Rock City — also known as Burning Man. The fundamental qualities of this city in the desert – the world’s largest intentional community – are freedom, experimentation, and participation, precisely the conditions in which new approaches to old (and emerging) problems can be conceived and realized.For most people who come each year to Burning Man, the shared dream is to take the values and aspirations of the Playa back to their homes, workplaces, and communities; to practice and promote the Ten Principles, not just on the playa once a year but all the time everywhere. Transforming the ‘real’ world is a formidable challenge and a powerful dream. 

Join us at TEDxBlackRockCity as we share the dream and encourage responsibility for making change happen.
print_description: "Smart & Simple" - TEDxBlackRockCity 2014 will highlight the Ideas Worth Sharing from selected citizens of Black Rock City.

title: That Sounds Crazy! How Are We Skillfully Holding a
description:
Our worldviews often include a diversity of understandings the dominant culture considers crazy. How do we let in increasing amounts of the invisible? How can we keep breaking open and not break? How do we balance revelations and responsibility, trust and urgency, collapses and courage? And what skillful language and methods have we found to share these sacred, genuine, crucial, crazy things so that we don't alienate potential allies, and grow solidarity across the shifts?

Joshua Halpern, MA is a transformation ecologist, an artist-activist-educator, and an edge jester. Josh will guide us through a co-creative, somatic-shamanic, love and justice minded, serious-fun forum for exploring these questions together. 

Josh has facilitated workshops around transforming homescapes for a half decade, has worked in local food justice for a decade, and has been sharing the earth through art for over two decades, all over the world. His work can be found at placeplaying.com and he can be reached at outsidejosh@gmail.com.
print_description: Our worlds shifting drastically! How are we healthily holding change and how do we skillfully share our stories among diverse communities and views?

title: That Sounds Crazy! Skills for Sharing Our Shifts
description: Our worlds are shifting so drastically! How are we healthily holding cascading change? And how are we skillfully sharing our stories among diverse communities and across multiple views? Our worldviews often include a diversity of understandings the dominant culture considers crazy. What's crazy to us? How have we let in increasing amounts of the invisible? How can we keep breaking open over and over and not break? How do we balance revelations and responsibility, trust and urgency, crises and courage? And what skillful language and methods have we found to share these sacred, genuine, crucial, crazy things - creating allies rather than alienating, growing solidarity across the shifts? Joshua Halpern, MA is a transformation ecologist, an artist-activist-educator, and an edge jester. Josh will co-creatively guide us through a body/place based, love/justice minded, skill/story sharing, serious/fun forum for exploring these questions together. Josh has facilitated workshops for transforming homescapes nearly a half decade, has worked in local food justice for about a decade, and has been sharing the earth through art for three wonderful decades, at homes, farms, and sacred sites all over the world. He holds an MA in Integral Ecology from CIIS and a BFA in Film from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. His work can be found at placeplaying.com and he can be reached at outsidejosh@gmail.com. Weds, 4:30-5:30pm, @ Camp Cosmicopia, 3:45 and Ephesus
print_description: Our world's shifting drastically! How are we healthily holding cascading change? And how do we skillfully share our stories among diverse communities?

title: THE COUNTER COUNTER CLOCKWISE MOVEMENT
description:
THE COUNTER COUNTER MOVEMENT (You're going the wrong way!!!)

Every fricken year, for some unexplainable reason, once the enflamed Man structure collapses and the safety perimeter is opened up, the fine citizens of Black Rock City decide to run around in circles, counter clockwise around the Man.

But the times, they are a changing…and the tide, she is a turning.  Join the counter counter movement this year and run COUNTER COUNTER CLOCKWISE (aka Clockwise) around the Man's burning carcass.

Participate and do your civic duty to help direct traffic the right way.  Take some time and bring along your own ONE WAY, WRONG WAY, or TURN AROUND sign, wear your reflective traffic vest, shout into your megaphone, blow into your traffic whistle, or do whatever else you can do to help change the direction.

Join the COUNTER COUNTER MOVEMENT, changing the course for huMANity.  The time is now.
print_description: Change course this year and run counter-counter-clockwise around the burning man's carcass.  Help direct traffic by bringing your own ONE WAY sign.

title: The First Black Rock City Sustainability Symposium
description:
Clutch Village is currently looking for Organizers, Presenters and Social-entrepreneurs for the first annual Black Rock City Sustainability Summit. The purpose of which is to spawn projects and partnerships that, over the course of one year will offset the entire carbon footprint of Burning Man. Upon our success, we will continue to do this every year, such that the net carbon footprint of Burning Man continues to become more and more negative every year. 

We need your help - this will not happen without you. If you want to become involved, whether it be organizing, presenting, or just generally being very excited, please send an email with a blurb about yourself and your project to: ClutchVillage@gmail.com

title: The Heart of Now
description:
The essence of the Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. In The Heart of Now workshop, you’ll come to know yourself more deeply. You’ll discover the possibility of reconnection with your innate beauty, wholeness and be honest with yourself and and with others in a safe circle of love. You can discover those places you’ve felt stuck, while you are supported in letting go. You learn to become aware of those times when you get in your own way, and come to see the choices open to you. You embrace what you desire the most, and deeply commit to letting your dreams and your visions be more important than you past wounds. You will find yourself reconnecting with your innate beauty, wholeness and power in each moment.

Heart of Now workshops include numerous assistants to support you and to create a sacred space for transformation. A deeply nurturing environment is created. This teamwork approach deepens the experience of service and camaraderie, where all are able to experience their vulnerabilities, allowing trust and growth. For questions visit our website www.HeartOfNow.org.
print_description: The essence of the Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. You’ll come to know yourself more.

title: The Heroic Life of Alexander “Sasha” Shulgin: An A
description:
Join us as we explore the rich and radically experimental revolutionary life of Alexander "Sasha" Shulgin. We will unpack the major turning points in his life and some of the profound contributions he gave to humanity.

with Chad Alexander Harris G.E.D
Chad has been a teaching assistant for Richard Tarnas at the California Institute of Integral Studies since 2004. He is a co-founder of the Institute of Archetypal Cosmology in San Francisco and also has a private practice there. He also has published an article on the history of the Israeli/Palestinian conflict in Archai: The Journal of Archetypal Cosmology. 2014 is his tenth year at Burning Man.
He has also been attending Burning Man since 2004
print_description: An exploration of the courageous pioneering experimental psychedelic chemist and his passing from our world this year.

title: The Nevada Burners Photo Shoot - 150 Years!
description:
The 2014 Nevada Burners Photo Shoot - 150 Years!

Please bring and join your fellow Nevada Burners for this fifth annual group photo at 4pm SHARP on Thursday August 28 at The Man (6:00 side) in Black Rock City. 

This year's photo will notably be a "Signature Nevada 150 Event" in celebration of Nevada's Sesquicentennial as a state.

The group photo will be freely available to download following the Burning Man event, and you can still see the photos of previous years, all here:

http://tinyurl.com/nevadaburnersphotos

The photo will be also be included in the Nevada Sesquicentennial Celebration Report presented to the Governor and filed in the Nevada State Library and Archives.

Join a hallmark of Nevada history. Please share widely. And don't be late! 

More on the Nevada Sesquicentennial here

https://www.nevada150.org/
print_description: Nevada Burners unite for a group photo celebrating the Nevada Sesquicentennial. This will be an official Signature Nevada 150 Event, so don't be late!

title: The No Fun Nickle and Dime Shit Show
description: There’s no television on the silk road, no ipods on the frontier, and no cell phones in the desert. Fittingly, this open mic night/talent show is geared towards more organic skills, paying homage to the Medicine show’s of yesteryear. Bring an instrument, perform a song, a dance routine, vaudeville shtick and any other DIY skill you’d love to astound a host of loving attendee’s with. Performers will also be subject to suggestions from Enchante as to how to make their art less fun.

title: The Orgasamator Experience

title: The Oracle
description:
Just as the Norse god Odin, took the head of Mimir to Asgard so it could be the eternal Oracle, the spirit of Burning Man has called upon the Nordic burners to bring Mimir to the Black Rock City. In the desert; amidst dreamers, visionaries, magicians and playful travelers, the Nordic Oracle will function as a portal for wisdom where burners connects with each other and the spirit of Burning Man.

The Oracle will have a strong voice, that will be felt by those who inquire and their experience will be remembered for years to come.

Odin's two ravens Hugin and Munin, will roam the desert, the playa, and search for the Burners that will be given the message that they are the ones, and they have the chance to become the voice of Mimir and the fate that the future brings. The Oracle will counsel and predict, make enigmatic statements, ambiguous or obscure utterances, allegories and revelations. Some will make sense and others will remain a mystery.

Burners gather in the Nevada because we are one kind, one force connected to the spirit of Burning Man. All that has been heard and all that has been seen will inspire to share the revelations.
print_description: The mythological Nordic god Odin and his two ravens Hugin and Munin will introduce you to meet and become the ancient Oracle Mimir.

Step up to the mic and face the gong as our snarky hosts and panelists judge your playa talents!  If we love you you’ll get hugs, spankings, and all the love your little burner heart can handle. If  your inadequate flag spinning or dumb yo yo tricks are subpar (or if we just flat out don’t like you) you’ll get the big ole gong and a relentlessly ribbing.  Don’t have a talent?  Come by and get gonged anyways…that’s half the fun!

title: The Poncho & Nacho Happy Hour
description:
For the third year running, Nacho (DC/NYC) & Poncho (LA) will dispense drinks, charm -- or so we claim -- and good cheer to fellow Burners. 

If we've met you before, come back! If you haven't, we'd love to meet you. Stop by, get yours and start your night right. 

We've scheduled this for two hours, but we reserve the right to keep at it if we (or, more importantly, you) are having a great time. 

Bonus: Some lucky guests might get one of Spirit's famous massages while supplies last.
print_description: For the third year running, Nacho & Poncho will dispense drinks, charm -- or so we claim -- and cheer. Stop by, get yours and start your night right.

title: The Psychedelic Eucharist
description: Psychedelics have been an integral part of the counterculture since they burst onto the scene during the revolutionary 1960s. Half a century later, human civilization still finds itself poised on the edge of social and ecological annihilation. The psychedelic experience, like much of the exotic infusions that shaped the consciousness of the 60s, has been all too easily appropriated by consumer capitalism, transformed into just another gimmick to satisfy our addiction to instant gratification. This talk will explore an alternative, alchemical interpretation of such experiences that serves to undermine the sort of ecologically and politically alienated mode of consciousness that continues to perpetuate capitalist social relations. Psychedelics are an invitation to re-imagine what it means to be human beings.
print_description: This talk will explore the effects of psychedelic medicines on human consciousness. What if there is an alchemical solution to the ecological crisis?

title: The Power of Human Attention
description: Come see what it’s like to tell your life story to a complete stranger.  Search deep, explore, then return the favor.  There’s no limit to the catharsis you will experience.  We’ll show you how.

title: The Psychedelic Visionary Art & Life of Alex Grey
description:
Art is one of the purest mediums for archetypal expression that humanity participates in.The careful study of an individual’s artistic pursuits provides one of the most vivid avenues of insight into the archetypal dynamics of the artist psyche.  In this discussion we will explore the archetypal correlations between the life and art of Alex Grey the with dynamic planetary alignments in his natal astrological chart. 
with Chad Alexander Harris G.E.D.
Chad has been a teaching assistant for Richard Tarnas at the California Institute of Integral Studies since 2004. He is a co-founder of the Institute of Archetypal Cosmology in San Francisco and also has a private practice there. 2014 will be his tenth year at Burning Man. He has also published an article on the history of the Israeli/Palestinian conflict  in Archai: The Journal of Archetypal Cosmology.
print_description: This discussion will explore the astrological dynamics correlating with the fascinating life and imagination of the visionary artist Alex Grey.

description: The figurehead and tyrannical magnate of the Playa Broadcasting network, Larry Harvey, is a pure genius and the man that makes PBN run like an irregularly-oiled jalopy.  Well, after a week out in the dust we are going to have the roast of all roasts, ribbing the fearless leader of our media conglomerate. Once everyone has gotten in their jokes, jabs, and quips we’ll be taking our Larry effigy to the man for the “roast” of his life.
print_description: Come join us as we comedically roast our figurehead and tyrannical magnate of the Playa Broadcasting network. Then we'll set him a flame burn night.

title: The science of Polymers!
description: A polymer based workshop. We examine the polymer chemistry behind hydrogel networks, which are often used in applications such as contact lenses, band aids, diapers, breast implants, and pills.
print_description: Let's examine the polymer chemistry behind hydrogel networks; often used in contact lenses, band aids, diapers, fake tits, band aids, pills and more!

title: Yoga and Meditation on the Subtle Body
description:
Have you ever felt Prana before? Or have you heard of it and been curious about it? Have you ever wanted to learn to better work with this phenomena to improve your well being?

In this workshop we will explore various postures, practices, movements and meditations that aim at awakening and influencing the subtle channels of energy in the body. What are the subtle channels in the body? What is the function and purpose of working with the subtle energy? 

Learning to pay attention more closely to the subtle energy flow in our bodies during our yoga practices can begin to open our awareness in ways we couldn't, when we just focused on the gross body. We will work on developing an awareness of subtle energy and then explore various theoretical models we can apply in our practice to positively transform our body, mind and deepen our yoga journey.
print_description: Yoga and Meditation on the Subtle Body

These include Anais Nin, Honore de Balzac, Letters to Penthouse, and more. Are you a reader or a listener or both? Or might you bring your own offerings?  Adults only, please.

title: THE SOUK
description: Come one, come all to the alluring, immersive atmosphere of the Souk in the tents surrounding the Man! Here you’ll find an exotic social center teeming with activity; mix and mingle with Souk keepers from all over the world, sample their wares, engage in conversation, games, performance art, activities and general nonsense! Community groups from across the Global Network will tempt you with delights beyond imagination in their hand-crafted marketplaces. Everyone is welcome to create an activity in our Souk, from dance to magic to interactive tomfoolery. The Souk will be open 24-7 starting at Midnight on Sunday, and will close on Friday afternoon. Immerse yourself in its surprises!!

title: The Truth about Lies
description: With empiricism and skepticism already having taken deep root in Western culture and several movements from modern psychology to give honesty a higher role in life, the moderators at First Kiss Cafe wish to invite all those who fancy themselves philosophers, intellectuals, or curious or passionate or just human to play both guardian angel and devil's advocate to these sacred cows as we try to deduce exactly how important truth is and what its role in the world should be.
print_description: A discussion on radical honesty, belief, and the real value of truth. Served with signature brand of Liquid Courage Cocktail to ease the transition.

title: The Stars Speak, We Listen
description:
9:00 PM- *Hottest On The Playa* 
Denise Kaisler- Astronomy professor
Come check out what the world looks like in infrared light. 
9:30 PM - *Makers in Spaaaaace* 
Jerry Isdale- 30+years as Software Engineer turned to more general Maker
The Maker Movement has blossomed along side the Playa culture. We are helping it address humanity's long-term survival and expansion into Space. 
10:00 PM- *The Junk Above Your Head: All About Space Debris!*
Shanna McIntyre- Aerospace engineer
Causes, effects, accuracy of the movie "Gravity," and the many very cool solutions being developed 
10:30 PM- *Black Holes and Bent Space*
Matt O'Dowd- astrophysicist 
The biggest telescopes in the universe consist of entire galaxies acting as gravitational lenses. We use them to study black holes. Cool, huh? 
11:00 PM- *The Mythology of the Constellations*
Anthony C Lanni 
A discussion on the constellations and the stories from Greek Mythology that gave them their names 
11:30 PM- *The Secrets of the Comets*
Michael Risch- Professional star guide and observatory builder 
Rosetta probe approaches a comet. What may these wanders in space tell us about ourselves?
12:00 AM- *Cosmic Archaeology*
Debbie- cosmologist and recovering particle physicist 
A discussion on the history of the Universe, and how that has a direct influence on us today. What is everything is made of? Where it comes from? and why is it so important that we understand the mysteries of Dark Matter and Dark Energy? 
12:30 AM- *New Horizons Space Craft*
Katie Bechtold- Operator of New Horizons spacecraft 
Katie will discuss her experience as an operator of a spacecraft headed for Pluto followed by a Q&A 
1:00 AM- *Astrobiology- the search for life on other celestial bodies*
Ianina Altshuler- Ianina's background is in Environmental Science 
The talk will introduce astrobiology, describe what analog cites are, and summarize the current and planned missions that are will look for life outside of Earth.
print_description: Lecture series with engineers, astrobiologists, makers, astrophysicists and professors talking about Astronomy!

title: Tongues and Minds
description: What is the source of language? How does this functional tool interact and guide our deepest thoughts and mental processes? title: Unlocking the Grid for Poi & Doubles
description:
Learn the theory that will completely open up the world of flowers and CAPS (continuous antispin patterns) for you and take your spinning to the next level! We will cover basic antispin moves and learn the practice of visualizing the grid you are spinning on. Then we will explore the possibilities that grid has to offer when you apply inspins, antispins, stalls and extensions to each quadrant, in various combinations. Once you know the basic theory and building block moves, you will be able to decipher and break down complex patterns you see other spinners execute. Most importantly, you will be able to experiment yourself and discover endless new patterns to play with.

This workshop assumes at least beginning   spinning skills.  Absolute beginners are welcome, but we will not spend any time teaching the basics.
print_description: Learn the theory that will completely open up the world of flowers and CAPS for you and take your spinning to the next level! Bring your props.

title: Unlicensed Primal Scream Therapy w/ Dr. Hymen
description:
Wutzzamatta cupcake? The Burn isn't turning out quite like you imagined? Are your camp mates annoying, gossipy little drama queens? Or lazy, worthless sack-of-shit hippies who only sit around playing those stupid fucking bongos, while stinking of patchouli? 

Did that furry guy ride by and you suddenly felt compelled to violence?

Accidentally hook up with a stage 5 clinger, and they're just not getting the hint? 

Perhaps you're mildly disappointed that every single event participant is not driven to spontaneous orgasm & backflips upon learning of your niche politic / lifestyle choices?

Are you too repressed and insecure to directly confront all the trifling mothafuckas driving you insane with rage? 

Well don't let all that pent up aggression drive you to stab everyone, come get it out so you (and everyone around you) can enjoy the rest of the Burn!

Technique will be introduced in camp, but actual practice will occur on the playa, at whichever big piece of art is closest.
print_description: Are you really, really, really fucking pissed about something? Don't cry in your pillow, you'll just have a brain aneurysm. Lets get those demons out.
other_location: Some art piece in central playa.

title: WeakDusty
description:
We have no Mud, and who cares about "Tough”…on the playa, it’s the WEAK DUSTY!  

The Weak Dusty is an fun endurance event where you’ll run a 2-5 mile course with military-style obstacles though various camps, starting and ending at Pink Lighting (home of BM 50K Ultramarathon, on Wednesday).  

Designed by Very Special Forces to test mental as well as physical strength, obstacles play on common fears, such as heights, burners, dubstep, monkey bars, sparkle ponies and jungle gyms.

The Weak Dusty encourages teamwork and partner/group participation. Participants must commit to helping others complete the course, putting teammates before themselves, overcoming fears and occasionally administering booze to those who need more. The event is untimed, and may involve strong alcoholic beverages for additional challenge and fun. 

Don't miss your workouts, you lazy and/or overly indulgent Burner!  Your body will thank you when you're back next week in default world...
print_description: No Mud, not Tough: it's WEAK DUSTY! Run 2-5m course over obstacles through theme camps. Designed by UnSpecial Forces, tests mental & physical strength

title: What are those 5Rhythms anyway? @RhythmWave
description: Just like light, sound, or ocean waves, a dancing body moving freely passes through five distinct rhythmic patterns. These patterns continuously repeat themselves in a wave of motion. The 5Rhythms are: FLOWING – the fluid, continuous, grounded glide of our own movements; STACCATO – the percussive, pulsing beat that shapes us a thousand different ways; CHAOS – the rhythm of letting go, releasing into the catalytic wildness of our dance that can never be planned or repeated; LYRICAL – the rhythm of trance, where the weight of self-consciousness dissolves, where we lighten up and disappear into our own uniqueness; and STILLNESS – the quiet emptiness, where gentle movements rise and fall, start and end, in a field of silence. Please join Marcia Dancing Heart for an introduction to the 5Rhythms at RhythmWave.

title: Wheel of Fortune
description: There is a wheel in the desert, unlike any other. This wheel contains YOUR fortune, YOUR future, YOUR fate…Come to the WHEEL OF FORTUNE! This is where your Hero's Journey begins. The Wheel of Fortune is an interactive divination tool made up of 22 doors featuring unique photographic interpretations of the Major Arcana cards of the Tarot. Inside you’ll find an elaborate gazebo, fire chandelier, and central seating made from salvaged materials. Silk Road Travelers, Card Readers, Gypsys, Oracles, and Destiny Seekers…come muse within. We offer this space as a sanctuary for self-reflection, exploration, universal connection - a Divine Refuge day and night for all citizens of Black Rock City! Join us for our Nightly Midnight Romps with fire, ceremony, song and dance... Be brave, Hero…. Your destiny awaits. Which door will YOU choose? Or which will choose you?

title: Where is Civilization Heading? Futurism Panel
description: In this panel, 4 futurists from different backgrounds will take questions regarding where civilization and our species is heading. Topics covered will include: -Will we make it as a species?, -What will the steady state human population be? -Predictions regarding the future of nations, religions, economics, and culture. -What is the likelihood for various collapse/ catastrophe predictions? -Will things go in the technological singularity direction, or a more earth based/ organic direction? -Will things go in the technological singularity direction, or a more earth based/ organic direction? A new vision for the next 100 years.  -Whats the role of the Burning Man community in helping shape the future?Facilitated by Daniel Pinchbeck, Daniel Schmactenberger, Jim Clark and More.

title: Worldly Wines Happy Hour
description: Vines Without Borders (Vines) is a global wine bar and lounge inviting guests and wines from around the world to convene for an unforgettable burn. Whether you’re an enophile (lover of wine) or a neophile (lover of new things) Vines is the first ‘port of call’ on your Caravansary journey. Our inviting venue features a lively lounge furnished with vintage couches and chairs, illuminated with LED lighting, showcasing a sleek LED back-lit bar designed and built especially for this burn. The Vines international wine theme is our unifying principle for global community and festivity. We will craft an intimate, interactive experience that provides opportunity for people from everywhere to drop in and enjoy discovering others on a deeper level, making connections that survive beyond the week. Our desire to connect stems from experience with our previous Camp Dawdle where we offered adventure rides on the Wheel of Passage. Guests loved the randomness and fun of the wheel rides, gave many thank-you hugs, but quickly moseyed on their merry way. It was unfortunately a fleeting interaction model. We felt we met many great souls but didn’t get to know any of them. With our new Vines concept, we increase our ‘stickyness’ with a cool wine lounge and an emphasis on international guests. Our wine focus and casual setting invites conversation while unavoidable language barriers ensure focused interaction, commitment to the moment and ultimately greater intimacy. Vines will bring together burners from around the world to make global connections around a unifying theme of wine.  In the spirit of Caravansary we will be a multicultural hub of interaction and wine sharing. We’ll enjoy the melody of world languages spoken throughout our camp and across our bar. Of course, we’ll also howl at our own grammatical gaffes while we resort to hand waving to articulate our most earnest points. What we’ll enjoy most will surely be the communion of the raised wine glass as we toast one another.
print_description: Visit Vines @ 4:45 & D for int'l wine happy hour M-F 7-10 in a relaxing lounge with uber cool LED-lit bar. Follow the Burner Bug Light to worldly wine

title: World's Largest Fire Blanket

title: WTS Pink lemonade Dive Bar
description: We are your (mostly) friendly neighborhood Dive Bar.  We bring out lots of Booze,  some powdered drinks for mixers, and even less ice.  But you might still end up loving us!  We have a bunch of fun bar games, Music & a pole for dancing, Schwag for prizes and gifting, lots of shade and couches for relaxing, & Entertaining Bartenders.  We tried to have a schedule last year, but we had so much fun with the citizens of Black Rock, we were open more than closed!!! So If you see our bar stools down off the bar, We are most likely open for business!!! Come join us for some drinks and good times.
print_description: Join us for lots of booze(not much ice),shade,games,music,schwag,& amusing Bartenders! We are open whenever we want! So barstools down means were open

title: Yin and Yang themed fly with friends
description: Have you ever thought to yourself, “Yoga is really great, but it would be even more awesome if I could share it with friends!” Or maybe you really enjoy the encouraging hands-on touch from a teacher that allowed you to discover something new in your personal practice. If so, this workshop is for you! We will explore our relationship to Yin and Yang through breath, movement, and balance with a challenging, yet restorative partner asana practice. Blending the wisdom of yoga, the dynamic power of acrobatics, and the healing elements of thai massage, you will leave feeling empowered, as well as nurtured. No experience necessary. You don’t need to bring a partner, but feel free to bring friends if you got ‘em!
print_description: We will explore our relationship to Yin and Yang through breath, movement, and balance with a challenging, yet restorative partner asana practice!

description:
Einstein said “I want to know how God created this world. I am not interested in this or that phenomenon, in the spectrum of this or that element. I want to know His thoughts; the rest are details.”

We plan on putting you on an ego trip you will never forget.  We have a bar with delectable drinks that will make everyone look almost as good as you.  There will be a spectacle of performers and a music line-up that will delight your fancy.

title: Your Fate Awaits
description:
Come take a spin at the Wheel of Life. The Wheel of Life Art Project will be operating during these hours:
Sun-Fri 10-noon, 2-4, 6-8, 10-midnight at the Souk.

Bring your birthdate and your open heart. We are creating alchemy through genuine love and respect on the playa....old hippie style and not ashamed of peace, love and understanding.  We have turned the wheel and now we offer you the wisdom of it's magic. We will be alternating Eastern and Western wheels and tarot decks.  On Thursday from 2-4 we will be leading the annual Gushing Woman Festival, a festival celebrating bliss through transformative ritual.  Gushing Woman came into being on a Bolinas California beach when the goddess appeared to a hippie artist on a vision quest to instruct him on surrendering to joy.  We will be giving away all of our water in symbolic prasad, bring your water bottle if you wish to receive some.  Whatever you do don't be bored, this is gonna be the best one yet.
print_description:
Come take a spin at the Wheel of Life. The Wheel of Life Art Project will be operating during these hours:
Mon-Fri 10-noon, 2-4, 6-8, 10-midnight

title: Your Own Silk-Road Ritual - Celebrate Caravansary
description: Join in this beautiful ritual and celebration to honor yourself, your friends, and the ones that have come before you on your personal silk road journey. If you consider yourself a nomad or you want to celebrate those in your life that are nomads or your ancestors that traveled miles, walked long-distances, explored many places so that you could be the person you are today than please join us at Gender Blender for this amazing ritual. Bring objects from your past journeys, objects to honor your ancestors, stories, costumes, and your open heart. Be prepared for celebration, connection, and a nomad gathering of epic proportion. Who knows you might even run into friends from your personal silk road journey. Whether you have been on the road for one month, one year, or many lifetimes, or even a day - this event is for you. We all are walking a journey, on a path of exploration, we all have our nomad stories and we all have powerful ancestors to honor. Join host Ariel, who has been wandering with purpose for 11 years, as ze guides you on a magical ritual journey that will honor your personal story and your lineage (both birth lineage and chosen family lineage). All genders and all stories welcome always.
print_description: Come join in a beautiful ritual to celebrate and honor those of us who identify as road warriors, nomads, travelers, and to honor our ancestors.

title: Zendo Compassionate Care
description: The Zendo Project is an onsite harm reduction service that offers a tranquil space and compassionate care for individuals seeking psychological support on the playa. Located at 2:00 and G in an open-air yurt-like structure, the Zendo will have trained volunteers available to offer peer counseling 24/7 from Wednesday 8/27 afternoon through Monday 9/1.
print_description: Trained volunteers and a safe, supportive space is available for anyone having a difficult psychological experience. Compassion, education, support.

title: Zendo Project Harm Reduction Training
description:
The Zendo Project will offer a tranquil space and compassionate care for individuals seeking psychological support on the playa. Located in an open-air yurt-like structure, the Zendo will have trained volunteers available to offer peer-to-peer counseling 24/7 from Wednesday 8/27 afternoon through Monday 9/1. 

The basic principles of our approach include: 
1. Create a safe space 
2. Sitting, not guiding 
3. Talk through, not down 
4. Difficult is not the same as bad. 

A challenging psychological experience is not necessarily a bad one. With proper preparation and understanding, it is possible to help someone having a difficult experience so they can receive the most benefit from it.
print_description: Zendo Project Training - come learn how to help out fellow burners in psychological distress and learn about our model for psych compassionate care!

title: World's Largest Fire Blanket
description: Senior Earth Guardian and Leave No Trace Master Educator Mike Bilbo will discuss the history of burn scars on the playa, Leave No Trace solutions, and Burning Man's stewardship through large scale solutions known as burn platforms. Learn also what is the latest protocol for building a fire when camping in back country areas. Then off we go via bike tour to see the world's largest fire blanket. How big is it, what is it made of? We will investigate.
print_description: Learn about burn scars, Leave No Trace solutions, and stewardship through large scale solutions known as burn platforms before biking out to see it.

title: WTS community stage and pole

The stage is always open, if were home and playing music requests are taken, but not always honored.  Guest dj's are welcome.  The possibilities are endless: hula hoop contests pole dancing competitions, live music! This stage is here for your creative freedom! Contact us if you want to schedual something :)
